title: Indian River County takes no action on proposal banning late-term abortions
description: Anti-abortion activists wanted Indian River County to ban late-term abortions, after 20 weeks pregnancy.
text_headers: Indian River county hears proposal to ban late-term abortions; takes no action on request
text: Indian River County takes no action on proposal banning late-term abortionsNews Indian River Martin St. Lucie Sports Advertise Obits eNewspaper Legals  SHAPING OUR FUTUREIndian River county hears proposal to ban late-term abortions; takes no action on request Colleen WixonTreasure Coast NewspapersINDIAN RIVER COUNTY — A proposal to regulate abortion clinics received little response Tuesday from county commissioners. About 50 people attended the commission meeting in support of  the proposal. Anti-abortion supporters wanted the county to ban late-term abortions after 20 weeks pregnancy and to require clinics provide women seeking abortions with more information about options and health. Florida law allows abortions up to 24 weeks, with late-term abortions permitted in emergencies. There is no abortion clinic in Indian River County. More:Pro-life group wants tighter regulations on abortion centers, ban on late-term abortionsCounty resident Paul Zelno, who helped spearhead the Safe Harbor for Life Ordinance with national organization Americans United for Life, said he hoped commissioners would consider the idea at another meeting. He said he didn't expect the commission to discuss the item Tuesday. Any county ordinance first would have to be vetted and the public given notice, Commission Chairman Joe Flescher said."We do not take any commission action on requests to speak," Flescher said. "At this juncture, I believe (the proposal) is best served at the state or federal government level, and not at the local government level."He called the the group's 40-minute presentation "very informative." More:'Parents Bill of Rights,' sponsored by Rep. Grall, backed in HouseColleen Wixon is the Indian River County government watchdog reporter for TCPalm.
